It had a multicultural community prior to the Ottoman period when it became entirely Greek. The Monastery of St. Catherine on Sinai was founded in the 6th cent. It had a multicultural community prior to the Ottoman period when it became entirely Greek. Alongside its Greek, Georgian, and Arabic mss. , the monastery preserves the most important collection of early Syriac mss. , after that of Dayr al-Suryān . The most famous of its manuscripts is Syr. 30, the palimpsest Old Syriac Gospels (unlike many of the monastery’s mss. , which are now in western libraries, this ms. remains in Sinai). After a fire in 1975 a blocked up room with further fragmentary mss. in different languages, including Syriac, was discovered. Whereas Dayr al-Suryān has transmitted Syr. Orth. mss. , those of St Catherine’s Monastery are almost all Melkite. See Fig. 32c . Sources S.
